Go to the application search page in the admin area

http://testdoaj.cottagelabs.com//admin/applications

column4: At the bottom of the list of facets is a "Reporting Tools" section, including 3 options for working with dates "limit by date range", "date applied histogram" and "last update histogram"
A histogram of the number of applications created per day since the reapplication (2014) is displayed

column3: Click on one of the years

column4: The search updates, and only records created in that year are displayed
The search filter list at the top of the results indicates the created date range (it may indicate the start and end months of the year)

column3: Go back to the Date Applied Histogram facet, and change the "Granularity" from "Year" to "Month"

column4: The histogram updates to show the number of journals created per month for the selected year

column3: Click on one of the months

column4: The search updates, and only records created in that month are displayed
The search filter list at the top of the results indicates the selected month

column3: Go back to the Date Applied Histogram facet.  Above it is the "Limit by Date Range" facet, open this by clicking on it

column4: The "Limit by Date Range" facet opens, showing a date range picker
Beneath the date range picker the "Date Applied" month you selected is also shown

column3: Remove the Date Applied limit by clicking the "X" either in the "Limit by Date Range" section or at the top of the search results

column4: The search results update to show all records

column3: Repeat the above steps for the "Last Update Histogram"
